TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PersonalizationProvider extends System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase
Public MustInherit Class PersonalizationProvider Inherits ProviderBase

summary.span: 实现个性化设置提供程序的基本功能。

span.span: Implements the basic functionality for a personalization provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 这是定义个性化设置提供程序所需功能的抽象基类。This is the abstract base class that defines the required functionality of a personalization provider. 个性化设置提供程序代表实例加载和存储个性化数据 。A personalization provider both loads and stores personalization data on behalf of a instance. 基类定义了许多方法的标准行为;只有那些专门处理基础数据存储区的方法才会标记为抽象。The base class defines standard behavior for a number of methods; only those methods that specifically deal with the underlying data store are marked abstract. 这允许开发人员编写自定义提供程序以与特定数据存储区交互，而无需重新实现类使用的标准功能 。This allows a developer to write a custom provider to interact with a specific data store, without needing to re-implement standard functionality used by the class.

para.span: 你可以从派生 并仅提供此类中定义的抽象方法的实现。

span.span: You can derive from and provide implementations for only the abstract methods defined in this class.

para.span: 抽象方法专门介绍了如何在物理数据存储区中保存数据并将数据加载到数据存储管理。

span.span: The abstract methods deal specifically with saving and loading data to a physical data store, and with data store administration.

para.span: 自定义提供程序必须能够以区分数据与数据的方式来操作个性化设置信息 。

span.span: A custom provider must be capable of manipulating personalization information in a manner that distinguishes data from data.

para.span: 此外，提供程序还必须按页以及应用程序划分个性化数据。

span.span: Furthermore, a provider must segment personalization data by page as well as by application.

para.span: 的实现 与的实现紧密耦合， 因为某些个性化设置提供程序方法返回 派生类的实例。

span.span: Implementations of are tightly coupled to implementations of because some personalization provider methods return instances of -derived classes.

para.span: 为了简化自定义提供程序的开发， 基类包含个性化设置逻辑的默认实现和直接由类使用的序列化/反序列化逻辑 。

span.span: To ease development of custom providers, the base class includes a default implementation of the personalization logic and serialization/deserialization logic that is used directly by the class.

para.span: 因此，创作仅用于处理不同数据存储的自定义提供程序只需要实现以下抽象方法：

span.span: As a result, authoring a custom provider solely for the purpose of working with a different data store only requires implementation of the following abstract methods:

para.span: - -对于所提供的查询参数，此方法需要能够计算数据库中个性化数据的行数。

span.span: - - This method needs to be able to count the number of rows of personalization data in the database for the supplied query parameters.

para.span: - -给定路径和用户名，此方法会从数据库中加载两个二进制大型对象 (Blob) ：一个用于共享数据的 BLOB，另一个用于用户数据。

span.span: - - Given the path and user name, this method loads two binary large objects (BLOBs) from the database: one BLOB for shared data and one for user data.

para.span: 如果提供了用户名和路径，则不需要 控件访问可提供用户名/路径信息的页面信息。

span.span: If you supply the user name and path, then you do not need the control to access the page information that can provide the user name/path information.

para.span: - -给定路径和用户名，此方法会删除数据库中的相应行。

span.span: - - Given the path and user name, this method deletes the corresponding row in the database.

para.span: 如果提供了用户名和路径，则不需要 控件访问可提供用户名/路径信息的页面信息。

span.span: If you supply the user name and path, then you do not need the control to access the page information that can provide the user name/path information.

para.span: - -给定路径和用户名，此方法会将提供的 BLOB 保存到数据库。

span.span: - - Given the path and user name, this method saves the supplied BLOB to the database.

para.span: 如果提供了用户名和路径，则不需要 控件访问可提供用户名/路径信息的页面信息。

span.span: If you supply the user name and path, then you do not need the control to access the page information that can provide the user name/path information.

para.span: 在所有这些方法中，如果只提供了路径，则指示对该页的共享个性化数据进行操作。

span.span: In all of these methods, if only a path is supplied, that indicates the shared personalization data for the page is being operated upon.

para.span: 如果路径和用户名都传递到方法，则应对该页的用户个性化设置数据进行操作。

span.span: If both a path and a username are passed to a method, then the user personalization data for the page should be acted upon.

para.span: 对于 ，应始终加载指定路径的共享数据，并且如果用户名不为，还应加载该路径的用户个性化数据 。

span.span: In the case of , the shared data for the specified path should always be loaded, and optionally the user personalization data for the path should also be loaded if the username is not .

para.span: 所有其他抽象方法仅适用于管理应用程序，在运行时，Web 部件基础结构不使用这些方法。

span.span: All other abstract methods are intended for use only in administrative applications and are not used by the Web Parts infrastructure at run time.

para.span: 有关个性化设置提供程序的实现的示例，请参见 类。

span.span: For an example of an implementation of a personalization provider, see the class.
ASP.NET Web Parts Controls
Web Parts Personalization Overview

related.span: 演练：使用用户控件实现 Web 部件个性化设置

span.span: Walkthrough: Implementing Web Parts Personalization with a User Control
Web Parts Personalization

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由于这是抽象类的构造函数，因此必须重写此方法，以创建从此类继承的类的实例。Because this is a constructor for an abstract class, you must override this method to create an instance of a class that inherits from this class.

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，获取或设置为提供程序配置的应用程序的名称。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the name of the application configured for the provider.

value.span: 为个性化设置提供程序配置的应用程序。

span.span: The application configured for the personalization provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在配置文件中未指定应用程序名称（使用 [提供程序元素进行个性化设置 (ASP.NET 设置架构) ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/51363b49-eafa-4b9c-b9d0-80086b385195) 属性），则 使用属性的值。If an application name is not specified in the configuration file using the [providers Element for personalization for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/51363b49-eafa-4b9c-b9d0-80086b385195) attribute, the value of the property is used. > [!CAUTION] > 由于单个的默认个性化设置提供程序实例可用于对象所提供的所有请求 ，因此可以同时执行多个请求，每个请求都尝试设置 属性值。Because a single, default personalization provider instance is used for all the requests served by an object, you can have multiple requests executing concurrently, each attempting to set the property value. 对于多个写入，属性不是线程安全的，并且更改 属性值可能会导致应用程序的多个用户产生意外行为。The property is not thread-safe for multiple writes, and changing the property value can result in unexpected behavior for multiple users of an application. 建议你避免允许用户设置属性的代码（ 除非必需）。It is recommended that you avoid code allowing users to set the property unless required. 例如，在管理多个应用程序的个性化设置数据的管理应用程序中，可能需要设置属性。Setting the property might be required, for example, in an administrative application that manages personalization data for multiple applications.

summary.span: 返回 对象的列表，这些对象表示 Web 部件控件集所使用的已知功能集。

span.span: Returns a list of objects that represent the set of known capabilities used by the Web Parts control set.

returns.span: 一个 ，它表示 Web 部件控件集所使用的已知功能集。

span.span: An that represents the set of known capabilities used by the Web Parts control set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 目前，此方法返回一个包含两个功能的列表： 和 。Currently, this method returns a list containing two capabilities: and . 这些是可在 authorization 元素中定义的默认功能，用于在 web 部件的个性化设置[ (](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c) [) (元素](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09)中为 Web 部件[ (ASP.NET settings schema) ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434)元素进行个性化设置。These are the default capabilities that can be defined in the [authorization Element for personalization for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434) element within the [personalization Element for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09) element of the [webParts Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c) configuration section. 如果选择实现自定义的个性化设置基础结构，则可以重写此方法，并定义自己的一组授权相关用户功能。If you choose to implement a custom personalization infrastructure, you can override this method and define your own set of authorization-related user capabilities.

summary.span: 确定初始个性化设置范围应为 还是 范围。

span.span: Determines whether the initial personalization scope should be or scope.

returns.span: 一个 ，它指示当前个性化设置范围是 还是 。

span.span: A indicating whether the current personalization scope is or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法确定当前范围是否应为 或 ，在给定对某个控件的引用 以及个性化设置生命周期内先前已加载的个性化设置状态信息时。This method determines whether the current scope should be or , given a reference to a control and the personalization state information that has already been loaded from earlier in the personalization life cycle. 此信息由 实例用于后续的与个性化相关的任务。This information is used by a instance for subsequent personalization-related tasks. 以下规则用于确定个性化设置范围：The following rules are used to determine personalization scope: - 范围最初假定为 。Scope is assumed initially to be . - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户未通过身份验证，则将范围设置为 。If the currently executing user account is not authenticated, the scope is set to . - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户已经过身份验证，则其他处理按优先级顺序进行：If the currently executing user account is authenticated, additional processing occurs in order of precedence: - 如果该页处于回发模式，则页面请求包含之前的页面呈现的作用域信息。If the page is in postback mode, the page request contains scope information from a previous rendering of the page. 如果该范围信息指示 使用了作用域，则该作用域的计算结果为 。If that scope information indicates that scope was used, then the scope evaluates to . - 如果当前正在执行的页的控件从另一页传输到它 (例如，如果由于调用方法导致了控制传输， 则为; 请注意，对于跨页面发送) 不会发生这种特定检查; 如果先前执行的页有一个 实例，则该范围将设置为 `Personalization.Scope` 上一实例中的属性的值 。If the currently executing page had control transferred to it from another page (for example, if the transfer of control occurred due to calling the method; note that this specific check does not occur for cross-page posting), and if the previously executing page had a instance, the scope is set to the value of the `Personalization.Scope` property from the previous instance. - 如果未满足上述条件，则作用域的计算结果为 当前控件的属性的值 。If the previous criteria are not met, then the scope evaluates to the value of the property for the current control. 进行上一次计算后，如果作用域的计算结果为 范围，则会进行以下处理：After the previous evaluations have been made, and if the scope evaluates to scope, the following processing occurs: - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户具有该 功能，则作用域仍设置为 。If the currently executing user account has the capability, the scope remains set to . - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户没有该 功能，则将此作用域重置为 。If the currently executing user account does not have the capability, then the scope is reset to . - 如果以前的所有范围评估的结果都是 ，则此结果将作为隐藏字段存储在当前正在执行的页上。If the result of all previous scope evaluations is , this result is stored as a hidden field on the currently executing page. 这是一种机制，通过该机制，页面可以在后续回发过程中重播作用域评估。This is the mechanism whereby a page can replay the scope evaluation during subsequent postbacks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认实现使用 authorization 元素中的信息 [进行 (个性化 ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434) 设置，以用于 web 部件的个性化设置 [ (元素 ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09) 中的 ASP.NET 设置架构) 元素。 (或) 文件中的 Webpart 元素的个性化元素中的设置架构) 元素 [Machine.config ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c) 配置节来确定用户的授权功能。The default implementation of this method consumes the information in the [authorization Element for personalization for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434) element within the [personalization Element for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09) element of the [webParts Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c) configuration section in the Machine.config or Web.config file to determine a user's authorized capabilities. 字典中的功能将是 方法返回的对象的成员 ，当前包含 功能和 功能。The capabilities in the dictionary will be members of the object returned by the method, which currently include the capability and the capability.

returns.span: ，包含零个或零个以上 派生对象。

span.span: A containing zero or more -derived objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于查询个性化数据的管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for querying personalization data. 派生实现应遵循如下所述的逻辑。Derived implementations should follow the logic described below. 返回项的集合受和参数的约束 `pageIndex` `pageSize` ，其中 `pageSize` 设置要返回的记录数，并 `pageIndex` 设置要返回的记录。The set of returned items is constrained by the `pageIndex` and `pageSize` parameters, where `pageSize` sets the number of records to return and `pageIndex` sets which records to return. 例如，值为 `pageIndex` 0 并且为 `pageSize` 25 时，将返回前25个匹配项，而 `pageIndex` 1 和25的值 `pageSize` 将返回出现26-50。For example, a `pageIndex` of 0 and a `pageSize` of 25 would return the first 25 occurrences, while a `pageIndex` of 1 and a `pageSize` of 25 would return occurrences 26-50. 如果要检索所有可用记录，请将设置 `pageIndex` 为0，将设置为 `pageSize` 。If you want to retrieve all available records, set `pageIndex` to 0 and `pageSize` to . 派生的对象按字母顺序返回，并按其和属性值的组合进行排序 ，两者都以升序进行排序。The -derived objects are returned in alphabetical order and sorted by a combination of their and property values, both in ascending order. 此方法将查询通配符传递到基础数据存储区。This method passes query wildcard characters to the underlying data store. 对通配符的支持当前依赖于每个访问接口如何处理星号 ( \* ) 、百分比符号 (% ) 或下划线 (_) 。Support for wildcard characters is currently dependent on how each provider handles characters such as an asterisk (\*), a percent symbol (%), or an underscore (_). 通常，对于符合 SQL 标准的数据存储区，可以在部分路径上执行通配符搜索，通配符字符显示在属性中搜索字符串文本的开头、末尾或中间 。Normally, for SQL-compliant data stores, you can perform a wildcard search on a partial path with the wildcard character appearing at the beginning, the end, or the middle of the search string text in the property. 例如，若要查找以 "/vdir" 开头的所有路径 \~ ，则该 属性将设置为 " \~ /vdir%"。For example, to find all paths that start with "\~/vdir", the property would be set to "\~/vdir%". 同样，在部分用户名上进行通配符搜索可能会在该属性的文本字符串中的任意位置显示通配符 。Likewise, a wildcard search on a partial user name could have the wildcard character appear at any point in the text string of the property. 例如，若要查找所有以 "John" 开头的用户名，该 参数将类似于 "john%"。For example, to find all user names that start with "John", the parameter would look like "John%". 下面的查询约束适用：The following query constraints apply: - 如果只 `scope` 提供了，并且 `query` 是 `null` 或的所有属性 `query` 返回 `null` 或默认值，则返回与指定参数匹配的所有记录 `scope` 。If only `scope` is provided, and `query` is `null` or all the properties on `query` return either `null` or default values, then all records matching the indicated `scope` parameter are returned. - 如果 属性不为 `null` ，则返回的记录也会根据与该值匹配的路径进行筛选 。If the property is not `null`, the returned records are also filtered based on paths that match the value. - 如果 属性不为 `null` ，则还会根据与属性值匹配的用户名来筛选返回的记录 。If the property is not `null`, the returned records are also filtered based on user names that match the property value. - 如果该 属性不等于 ，则返回的记录也将进行筛选，以仅返回与非活动用户关联的那些记录。If the property is not equal to , then the returned records are also filtered to return only those records associated with inactive users. 比较包含 属性小于或等于属性的记录 。The comparison includes records where the property is less than or equal to the property. 请注意，此方法不会验证查询参数的组合。Note that this method does not validate combinations of query parameters. 例如，代码可以请求一组与共享作用域中的特定用户名相关联的个性化设置状态记录。For example, code can request a set of personalization state records associated with a specific user name in the shared scope. 由于用户名不与共享信息关联，因此返回的集合将为空。Because user names are not associated with shared information, the returned collection would be empty. 有可能返回非空集合的参数组合包括：Parameter combinations that have the potential to return a non-empty collection include: - 作用域与属性的组合 。 scope in combination with the property. - 将范围与 、和属性的任意或全部值组合在一起 。 scope in combination with the values for any or all of the , , and properties.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于检索个性化设置数据计数的管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for retrieving counts of personalization data. 派生实现应遵循如下所述的逻辑。Derived implementations should follow the logic described below. 此方法将查询通配符传递到基础数据存储区。This method passes query wildcard characters to the underlying data store. 对通配符的支持当前依赖于每个访问接口如何处理星号 ( \* ) 、百分比符号 (% ) 或下划线 (_) 。Support for wildcard characters is currently dependent on how each provider handles characters such as an asterisk (\*), a percent symbol (%), or an underscore (_). 通常，对于符合 SQL 标准的数据存储区，可以在部分路径上执行通配符搜索，通配符字符显示在属性中搜索字符串文本的开头、末尾或中间 。Normally, for SQL-compliant data stores, you can perform a wildcard search on a partial path with the wildcard character appearing at the beginning, the end, or the middle of the search string text in the property. 例如，若要查找以 "/vdir" 开头的所有路径 \~ ，则该 属性将设置为 " \~ /vdir%"。For example, to find all paths that start with "\~/vdir", the property would be set to "\~/vdir%". 同样，在部分用户名上进行通配符搜索可能会在该属性的文本字符串中的任意位置显示通配符 。Likewise, a wildcard search on a partial user name could have the wildcard character appear at any point in the text string of the property. 例如，若要查找所有以 "John" 开头的用户名，该 参数将类似于 "john%"。For example, to find all user names that start with "John", the parameter would look like "John%". 下面的查询约束适用：The following query constraints apply: - 如果只 `scope` 提供了，并且 `query` 是 `null` 或的所有属性 `query` 返回了 `null` 或默认值，则将对与指定的参数匹配的所有记录 `scope` 进行计数。If only `scope` is provided, and `query` is `null` or all the properties on `query` return either `null` or default values, then all records matching the indicated `scope` parameter are counted. - 如果该 属性不为 `null` ，则还会根据与该值匹配的路径来筛选计数记录 。If the property is not `null`, the counted records are also filtered based on paths that match the value. - 如果 属性不为 `null` ，则还会根据与属性值匹配的用户名筛选计数记录 。If the property is not `null`, the counted records are also filtered based on user names that match the property value. - 如果该 属性不等于 ，则计数记录也会进行筛选，以仅返回与非活动用户关联的那些记录。If the property is not equal to , then the counted records are also filtered to return only those records associated with inactive users. 比较包含 属性小于或等于属性的记录 。The comparison includes records where the property is less than or equal to the property. 请注意，此方法不会验证查询参数的组合。Note that this method does not validate combinations of query parameters. 例如，代码可以请求与共享作用域中的特定用户名相关联的个性化设置状态记录的计数。For example, code can request a count of personalization state records associated with a specific user name in the shared scope. 由于用户名不与共享信息关联，因此返回的计数将为零。Because user names are not associated with shared information, the returned count would be zero. 可能返回非零计数的参数组合包括：Parameter combinations that have the potential to return a non-zero count include: - 作用域与属性的组合 。 scope in combination with the property. - 将范围与 、和属性的任意或全部值组合在一起 。 scope in combination with the values for any or all of the , , and properties.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生自 并实现此方法的类应将 `webPartManager` 、 `path` 和 `username` 参数用作检索键。Classes that derive from and implement this method should use the `webPartManager`, `path`, and `username` parameters as retrieval keys. 无论数据存储在数据存储中的方式如何 (某些数据存储可能会执行某种类型的智能存储) ，必须在两个数组中以打包的字节集的形式返回个性化数据。Regardless of how the data is stored in the data store (some data stores might perform some type of intelligent storage), the personalization data must be returned as a packed set of bytes in two arrays. 返回的数据必须符合以下规则：The returned data must conform to the following rules: - 范围的数据 必须始终在参数中返回 `sharedDataBlob` 。The data for the scope must always be returned in the `sharedDataBlob` parameter. - 根据键值，将在 参数中返回数据 `userDataBlob` 。Depending on the key values, data is returned in the `userDataBlob` parameter. 参数的非 `null` 值 `userName` 指示 还应检索数据。A non-`null` value for the `userName` parameter indicates that data should also be retrieved. 从派生并实现此方法的个性化设置提供程序 可以通过在一次往返过程中检索所有个性化数据来优化与其数据存储区的交互，而不是 在两个单独的往返行程中检索和数据。A personalization provider that derives from and implements this method can optimize interactions with its data store by retrieving all personalization data in one round trip, as opposed to retrieving and data in two separate round trips.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是 类用于加载个性化设置数据的主入口点。This method is the main entry point used by the class to load personalization data. 默认实现从基础数据存储区加载原始数据 (功能在派生的提供程序中实现) 然后将原始数据转换为 实例。The default implementation loads the raw data from the underlying data store (functionality is implemented in derived providers) and then converts the raw data into a instance. 如果 `ignoreCurrentUser` 参数为 `true` ，则不会向方法传递任何用户名 。If the `ignoreCurrentUser` parameter is `true`, no user name is passed to the method. 个性化设置提供程序可以选择将此解释为，这意味着只 应从基础数据存储中检索具有范围的个性化设置状态。A personalization provider can choose to interpret this as meaning that only personalization state with a scope should be retrieved from the underlying data store. 当 方法执行时，它会调用 方法，并且在加载状态时可能会发生三种类型的反序列化错误。When the method is executing, it calls the method, and there are three types of deserialization errors that can occur as the state is being loaded. 当发生这些特定的错误时，不会引发异常，而是通过运行状况监视功能记录错误事件 (有关运行状况监视和访问其创建的日志的信息，请参阅 [ASP.NET Health Monitoring 概述](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e003f224-70fe-4cd8-a71a-2dc81e2d7e4c)) 。When these specific errors occur, no exception is thrown, and the error events are logged instead by the Health Monitoring feature (for information on health monitoring and accessing the logs created by it, see [ASP.NET Health Monitoring Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e003f224-70fe-4cd8-a71a-2dc81e2d7e4c)). 以下三种情况会导致将反序列化错误事件写入日志：The following three scenarios cause deserialization error events to be written to the log: - 尝试反序列化使用字符串的属性类型失败 。A failed attempt to deserialize a property type that uses a string . - 尝试反序列化使用二进制序列化的属性类型失败。A failed attempt to deserialize a property type that uses binary serialization. - 尝试反序列化属性类型失败，因为无法创建该类型的实例。A failed attempt to deserialize a property type because an instance of the type cannot be created.

span.span: The is .
The page associated with is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生自 并实现此方法的类应使用 `webPartManager` 、 `path` 和 `userName` 参数作为存储密钥。Classes that derive from and implement this method should use the `webPartManager`, `path`, and `userName` parameters as storage keys. 派生的实现必须修改数据存储，以便有效地删除所提供的存储密钥的个性化数据。Derived implementations must modify the data store so that personalization data for supplied storage keys is effectively deleted. 派生实现取决于其物理实现方式。It is up to the derived implementations as to how they physically accomplish this. 派生的个性化设置提供程序必须能够以每页的方式区分个性化数据。The derived personalization provider must be able to distinguish personalization data on a per-page basis. 此外，对于给定页面的状态，个性化设置提供程序必须能够区分 数据和范围数据。Furthermore, for a given page's state, the personalization provider must be able to distinguish between and scope data. 如果提供了一个非 `null` 用户名，则重置操作将应用于该 作用域; 否则，重置操作将应用于该 作用域。If a non-`null` user name is provided, then the reset operation applies to the scope; otherwise, the reset operation applies to the scope.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于删除个性化设置数据的管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for deleting personalization data. 派生实现应遵循如下所述的逻辑。Derived implementations should follow the logic described below. 此方法不支持通配符搜索。No wildcard character searches are supported by this method. 如果个性化设置提供程序公开了事务感知数据存储区中的数据，则此方法应以单个原子事务的形式执行其操作。If the personalization provider exposes data from a transaction-aware data store, this method should perform its operations as a single atomic transaction. 仅允许以下参数组合：Only the following combinations of parameters are allowed: - `scope`设置参数，并将所有其他参数设置为 `null` 。The `scope` parameter is set, and all other parameters are set to `null`. 此组合将删除与所指示的个性化设置范围关联的所有 Web 部件的个性化设置数据 `scope` 。This combination deletes all Web Parts personalization data associated with the personalization scope indicated by `scope`. - `scope`设置了参数，且 `paths` 参数至少包含一个值。The `scope` parameter is set, and the `paths` parameter contains at least one value. 此组合将删除所指示的个性化设置范围中的指定路径的所有 Web 部件的个性化设置数据 `scope` 。This combination deletes all Web Parts personalization data for the specified path or paths in the personalization scope indicated by `scope`. - `scope`参数设置为 ， `paths` 参数设置为，仅包含一个值，并且 `usernames` 参数至少包含一个值。The `scope` parameter is set to , the `paths` parameter is set and contains only one value, and the `usernames` parameter contains at least one value. 此组合将删除与中包含的用户或用户关联的给定路径的所有用户个性化 Web 部件数据 `usernames` 。This combination deletes all user personalization Web Parts data for the given path that is associated with the user or users contained in `usernames`. - `scope`参数设置为 ， `paths` 参数设置为 `null` ，并且 `usernames` 参数至少包含一个值。The `scope` parameter is set to , the `paths` parameter is set to `null`, and the `usernames` parameter contains at least one value. 此组合将删除与中包含的用户或用户关联的所有路径中每个用户的个性化 Web 部件数据 `usernames` 。This combination deletes all per-user personalization Web Parts data, across all paths, associated with the user or users contained in `usernames`. 参数值的任何其他组合均无效，并将引发 异常。Any other combination of parameter values is invalid and will throw an exception. 具体而言，不允许使用以下两种组合：Specifically, the following two combinations are not allowed: - `usernames`当设置为时，不能提供参数 `scope` 。The `usernames` parameter cannot be provided when `scope` is set to . - 参数不 `paths` 能包含多个项 `usernames` `null` 。The `paths` parameter cannot contain more than one entry when the `usernames` parameter is not `null`. `paths` `usernames` 各个数组中包含的任何和参数值都必须满足下列验证规则。Any `paths` and `usernames` parameter values contained within the respective arrays must meet the following validation rules. 如果任何参数数组成员的任何验证规则都失败，则 会引发异常。If any validation rules fail for any member of the parameter arrays, an exception is thrown. 验证规则如下：The validation rules are: - `null` 不允许使用值。`null` values are not allowed. - 不允许使用空字符串 ( "" ) 。An empty string ("") is not allowed. 在执行空字符串检查之前，应剪裁参数。Parameters should be trimmed prior to performing an empty string check. - `usernames`参数不能包含逗号 (，) 。The `usernames` parameter cannot contain commas (,). - `paths`对于 SQL 数据库，参数的长度不能超过256个字符。The length of the `paths` parameter cannot be greater than 256 characters for a SQL database. - `usernames`对于 SQL 数据库，参数的长度不能超过256个字符。The length of the `usernames` parameter cannot be greater than 256 characters for a SQL database.

returns.span: 从基础数据存储区中删除的行数。

span.span: The number of rows deleted from the underlying data store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于删除个性化设置数据的管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for deleting personalization data. 请注意，此方法仅影响用户个性化数据，而不影响共享数据。Note that this method affects only user personalization data, and not shared data. 派生实现应遵循如下所述的逻辑：Derived implementations should follow the logic described below: - `path`参数不能包含通配符。The `path` parameter cannot contain wildcard characters. - 如果提供程序公开了事务感知数据存储区中的数据，则此方法应在单个原子事务中执行其操作。If the provider exposes data from a transaction-aware data store, this method should perform its operations in a single atomic transaction. - 如果 `path` 参数不为 `null` ，则仅删除与关联的每用户个性化设置记录 `path` 。If the `path` parameter is non-`null`, then only per-user personalization records associated with `path` will be deleted. - 只有自参数中指示的日期后，与被视为非活动状态的用户关联的每用户个性化设置记录 `userInactiveSinceDate` 将被删除。Only per-user personalization records associated with users that are considered inactive since the date indicated in the `userInactiveSinceDate` parameter will be deleted. 具体而言，将 删除小于或等于的记录 。Specifically, records where is less than or equal to are deleted. - 如果同时提供了这两个参数，则将删除匹配这两个约束的记录。If both parameters are provided, then records that match both constraints are deleted. - `path`参数可以是 `null` 。The `path` parameter can be `null`. - `path`参数不能为空字符串。The `path` parameter cannot be an empty string. 在执行此检查之前，应进行剪裁。It should be trimmed prior to performing this check. - 属性不能为 `null`。The property cannot be `null`.

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，将原始个性化设置数据保存到基础数据存储区中。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, saves raw personalization data to the underlying data store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于将原始个性化设置数据保存到基础数据存储区的方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of the method used for saving raw personalization data to the underlying data store. 派生实现应使用 `webPartManager` 、 `path` 和 `userName` 参数作为存储密钥。Derived implementations should use the `webPartManager`, `path`, and `userName` parameters as storage keys. 派生的个性化设置提供程序必须能够以每页的方式区分个性化数据。The derived personalization provider must be able to distinguish personalization data on a per-page basis. 此外，对于给定页面的状态，提供程序必须能够区分 和 作用域。Furthermore, for a given page's state, the provider must be able to distinguish between and scope. 如果提供了非 `null` 用户名，则 `dataBlob` 参数在 范围内; 否则，该参数将被 `dataBlob` 视为在 范围内。If a non-`null` user name is provided, then the `dataBlob` parameter is in scope; otherwise, the `dataBlob` parameter is assumed to be in scope.

param.span: ，包含要保存的个性化设置数据。

span.span: A containing personalization data to be saved.

summary.span: 将个性化设置数据保存到数据存储区中。

span.span: Saves personalization data to a data store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是 类用于保存个性化设置数据的主入口点。This method is the main entry point used by the class to save personalization data. 此方法的默认实现使用的内部实现的方法 将个性化设置数据打包到字节数组中。The default implementation of this method uses the methods of an internal implementation of to pack personalization data into a byte array. 如果此打包的结果创建一个空字节数组 (因为属性提取导致没有个性化数据) ，则默认实现将调用 方法。If the results of this packing create an empty byte array (because property extraction resulted in no personalization data), the default implementation calls the method. 否则，默认实现将调用 方法。Otherwise, the default implementation calls the method.

span.span: is .

exception.span: 正在保存的 对象与 方法返回的 对象类型不同。

span.span: The object being saved has a different type from the object that was returned by the method.
